verses.verse: Also with moisture He saturates the thick clouds; He scatters His bright clouds.
And they swirl about, being turned by His guidance, That they may (Job 36:32; Ps. 148:8) do whatever He commands them On the face of the whole earth.
(Ex. 9:18, 23; 1 Sam. 12:18, 19) He causes it to come, Whether for correction, Or (Job 38:26, 27) for His land, Or (1 Kin. 18:41-46) for mercy.
“Listen to this, O Job; Stand still and (Ps. 111:2) consider the wondrous works of God.
Do you know when God dispatches them, And causes the light of His cloud to shine?
(Job 36:29) Do you know how the clouds are balanced, Those wondrous works of (Job 36:4) Him who is perfect in knowledge?
Why are your garments hot, When He quiets the earth by the south wind?
With Him, have you (Gen. 1:6; (Is. 44:24)) spread out the (Job 9:8; Ps. 104:2; (Is. 45:12; Jer. 10:12; Zech. 12:1)) skies, Strong as a cast metal mirror?
“Teach us what we should say to Him, For we can prepare nothing because of the darkness.
Should He be told that I wish to speak? If a man were to speak, surely he would be swallowed up.
Even now men cannot look at the light when it is bright in the skies, When the wind has passed and cleared them.
He comes from the north as golden splendor; With God is awesome majesty.
As for the Almighty, ((Job 11:7, 8; Rom. 11:33, 34; 1 Tim. 6:16)) we cannot find Him; ((Job 9:4; 36:5)) He is excellent in power, In judgment and abundant justice; He does not oppress.
Therefore men ((Matt. 10:28)) fear Him; He shows no partiality to any who are ((Job 5:13; Matt. 11:25); 1 Cor. 1:26) wise of heart.”
(The LORD Reveals His Omnipotence to Job) Then the LORD answered Job (Ex. 19:16; Job 40:6) out of the whirlwind, and said:
“Who (Job 34:35; 42:3) is this who darkens counsel By (1 Tim. 1:7) words without knowledge?
(Job 40:7) Now prepare yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall answer Me.
“Where (Job 15:7; Ps. 104:5) were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Tell Me, if you have understanding.
Who determined its measurements? Surely you know! Or who stretched the line upon it?
To what were its foundations fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone,
When the morning stars sang together, And all (Job 1:6) the sons of God shouted for joy?
“Or (Gen. 1:9; Ps. 33:7; 104:9; Prov. 8:29; (Jer. 5:22)) who shut in the sea with doors, When it burst forth and issued from the womb;
When I made the clouds its garment, And thick darkness its swaddling band;
When (Job 26:10) I fixed My limit for it, And set bars and doors;
When I said, ‘This far you may come, but no farther, And here your proud waves ((Ps. 89:9; 93:4)) must stop!’
“Have you ((Ps. 74:16; 148:5)) commanded the morning since your days began, And caused the dawn to know its place,
That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, And (Job 34:25; Ps. 104:35) the wicked be shaken out of it?
It takes on form like clay under a seal, And stands out like a garment.
From the wicked their (Job 18:5; (Prov. 13:9)) light is withheld, And ((Num. 15:30); Ps. 10:15; 37:17) the upraised arm is broken.
“Have you ((Ps. 77:19); Prov. 8:24) entered the springs of the sea? Or have you walked in search of the depths?
Have (Ps. 9:13) the gates of death been revealed to you? Or have you seen the doors of the shadow of death?
Have you comprehended the breadth of the earth? Tell Me, if you know all this.
“Where is the way to the dwelling of light? And darkness, where is its place,
That you may take it to its territory, That you may know the paths to its home?
Do you know it, because you were born then, Or because the number of your days is great?
“Have you entered (Ps. 135:7) the treasury of snow, Or have you seen the treasury of hail,
(Ex. 9:18; Josh. 10:11; Is. 30:30; Ezek. 13:11, 13; Rev. 16:21) Which I have reserved for the time of trouble, For the day of battle and war?
By what way is light diffused, Or the east wind scattered over the earth?
“Who (Job 28:26) has divided a channel for the overflowing water, Or a path for the thunderbolt,
To cause it to rain on a land where there is no one, A wilderness in which there is no man;
(Ps. 104:13, 14; 107:35) To satisfy the desolate waste, And cause to spring forth the growth of tender grass?
